channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024060581
item.description:
Report E-2024060581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, at 0911 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Zep Zepresto. It was reported that the terminal personnel discovered a release of a total of 1 cup of ZEP ZEPRESTO (UN2922, Corrosive liquids, toxic. n.o.s. (Cresylic Acid Methylene Chloride), 8, 6.1, II) from (2) 20-gallon DM’s due to improper packaging. The release impacted shrink wrap and a pallet. Terminal personnel were able to patch the puncture to the drums, then placed the damaged drums into a 95-gallon overpack DF. Terminal personnel then cleaned the release with the appropriate PPE.

item.title: Report X-2024061188
item.description:
Report X-2024061188

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: Sauk Village
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A worker was about to hook to a trailer to pull it away from the dock and out into the yard when he noticed that the nose of the trailer was leaking. CURA was called to handle cleaning the spill and advised that it appeared a wrapped pallet of pails had shifted in transit which caused some of the pa ils to topple and one of those pails was punctured as it fell which caused the release.

item.title: Report E-2024060542
item.description:
Report E-2024060542

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) teaspoon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and damaged pail into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted are and containerized the damaged jug and cleanup debris into one (1) 20-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061338
item.description:
Report X-2024061338

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO DRY ICE SUBLIMATION VISIBLY EMITTING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE OUTER BOX WAS ALSO VISIBLY BREAKING DOWN FROM THE RELEASE OF THE VAPORS. THE OUTER BOX IS MARKED HANDLE WITH CARE AND FROZEN MEAT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024060485
item.description:
Report E-2024060485

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 13, 2024, one (1) 70-pound battery was punctured and released approximately 1.5-gallons od battery acid to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged batteries were placed into one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060441
item.description:
Report E-2024060441

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 12, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint fell in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-24T15:13:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-08
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found emitting a white gas while traveling on the belts. Package was removed from belt and brought to QA for inspection and was found to contain pressurized cans of 134a refrigerant. One can had split just above the seam at the bottom of the can. Checking SDS indicates items is a regulated hazmat UN 3159. Package does not have any labeling at all indicating a hazmat package.

item.title: Report E-2024060387
item.description:
Report E-2024060387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDP experienced a UN1760 Step Down Low Odor Finish Liquidator release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a load shift, causing the pallet to tip over. The impacted area was cleaned and neutralized with citric acid solution, baking soda, and absorbents. The damaged pail and all impacted cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining pails in the shipment were re-stacked and secured for continued transit. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: That pallet collapsed and one of the boards of the pallet pierced a bag which caused a release of roughly 1 pound of UN1823 which was contained to the pallet. CURA was contacted to coordinate a crew to clean the spill.

item.title: Report E-2024060428
item.description:
Report E-2024060428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: ELK GROVE VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6in-by-200ft area of the concrete roadway and a 53’-by-8ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to load shift that resulted in a puncture to one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The trailer was offloaded to locate the damaged container. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer and then used granular absorbents and pads to gather the released material. The impacted pallets were broken down and placed into three (3) 55-gallon poly drums. Various cleanup debris and spent absorbents were gathered and placed into four (4) additional 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was over packed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum still containing approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product. The generated waste was left at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
